page.title: 10THE RIVER OGMORE
page.content: THE RIVER OGMORE STARTS AT THE BWLCH AND FLOWS SOME SEVENTEEN MILES TO THE SEA AT OGMORE-BY-SEA. THE GARW RIVER JOINS THE OGMORE RIVER AT BRYN-MENYN, THE LLYMFI RIVER JOINING IT A MILE FURTHER ON AT ABERKENFIG. THE RIVER ALSO FLOWS TO THE WATERWORKS IN NANTYMOEL, WHICH WAS BUILT IN 1926 AND IS SITUATED AT ONE OF THE HIGHEST POINTS IN THE VALLEY. IT FLOWS INTO THE SETTLING TANK WHERE ANY MUD IN THE WATER IS FILTERED AND SETTLES AT THE BOTTOM. THE WATER GOES DOWN THE MAIN PIPE INTO THE FILTER HOUSE WHERE IT IS CLEANED. CHLORINE IS ADDED TO KILL ANY GERMS LEFT IN THE WATER. AT OGMORE-BY-SEA, A LARGE SEWERAGE PLANT CLEANS ALL THE WASTE MATERIALS SO THAT CLEAN WATER FLOWS BACK INTO THE RIVER.
